short_summary: Stream to Sea program and community outreach services
description: Stream to Sea program and community outreach services are required throughout the year for the Prince George Area of BC. Delivery and coordination of these services will align with the geographic area.
full_summary:
**Notice of Invitation to Tender: Education Coordinator Services - Prince George Area**
=====================================================

**Request for Proposal**
-------------------------

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) invites proposals from interested contractors for the provision of education coordination services in the Prince George area of British Columbia.

**Project Overview**
-------------------

The DFO requires a contractor to provide delivery and coordination services for the Stream to Sea program and related community outreach activities in the Prince George area. The contractor will work closely with the Community Advisor (CA) to develop a work plan and deliver services that align with the program's objectives.

**Scope of Work**
-----------------

The successful contractor will be responsible for:

* Coordinating and assisting with the setup of classroom incubators
* Delivering salmon eggs to schools and providing teacher in-service training
* Providing support and maintenance of the DFO classroom incubation program
* Organizing teacher in-service workshops and liaising with school districts
* Coordinating equipment and supplies, as well as egg deliveries and fry releases

**Requirements**
-----------------

The contractor must:

* Have experience in education coordination services, particularly in the Stream to Sea program
* Be able to work collaboratively with the CA and other stakeholders
* Possess excellent communication and project management skills
* Have a strong understanding of the program's objectives and outcomes

**Evaluation Criteria**
----------------------

The proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Quality of the proposal and contractor's experience
* Ability to deliver the scope of work
* Project management and coordination skills
* Communication and collaboration skills
* Understanding of the program's objectives and outcomes

**Tender Details**
------------------

* Tender Reference Number: PW-22-01004762
* Solicitation Number: 30003041A
* Tender Closing Date: 2022-09-02T09:00:00
* Publication Date: 2022-08-18
* Contact Information:
	+ Name: Martin, Kimberly
	+ Email: DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
	+ Phone: 506-429-2397

**Attachments**
-----------------

The complete tender package, including the invitation to tender and appendix documents, can be downloaded from the Buying for Canada website.

 Please note that this tender has expired. The RFP and its links still provide valuable information about the process. Let me know if you want me to modify this output.
